result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren D Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 06/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days jail for non-payment.
Costs to be paid along with fine.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  Expunction is conditionally granted After 6 months, and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees/fines and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauren D Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lauren D Miller in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   FINE:  $389.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 6/1/16, alternate 12 days jail if not paid)  

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

***Expunction is conditionally granted after 6 months upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
to appear filed by Attorney Rosario

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Lauren D Miller did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Anthony Rosario

Defendant Lauren D Miller in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests an adjournment as he was just assigned to this case.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Walmart Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Lauren D Miller in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
